page.title: 11HARTHILL SCHOOL COOKS
page.content: We interviewed Mrs Jones and Mrs Ashley the cooks at Harthill C.P.School. They both thought it took a long time to prepare things like iced cakes. They said they liked their own food too! Our cooks enjoy their job so much they would not change. Mrs Jones works a 5 hour day, Mrs Ashley works a 2.5 hour day.They prepare 46 lunches each day.The food comes from Kitchens Amalgamated Food Ltd. and Morrris and Jones. The menu is planned monthly, the leftovers are put in a bin for the pigs at a nearby farm.Mrs Ashley has to wash the floor once a day. When they make a meal they put a sample of it on a plate so that if there is an outbreak of foodpoisoning the Health Inspecter can check it. They call this a Fairy Plate. By Claire and Fiona.
